A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This is a decent adventure/action film (a bit light on the action) but as a Star Wars film\, this is a larger disconnect from the soul of its fan-base than the prequels\, which is an incredible achievement. 

This really shouldn't be necessary as a qualifier\, but I'm a lefty\,  bleeding heart\,  progressive pansy\,  and I still hate this movie. I only mention this as there seems to be an unforgivable accusatory tone levelled at anyone who criticises this movie as an attempt to undermine the first central female protagonist in the Saga. If you're intellectually honest\, said protagonist deserved a better script without key information omitted and unforgivable logical inconsistencies that just drag you out of this world. 

This is enough to check me out of this universe. It was a delight to have Rogue One produced in this new wave of Disney films. But\,  for me\,  this is as far as I can go. 

If anyone harbours any hope for Episode 9\, take little comfort in the fact that it's writer\, Chris Terrio\, comes hot off of the heels of such cinematic masterpieces an BvS and Justice League. Wouldn't you just love to be a fly on the wall when these things are decided.
